children.definition: Permitted Holders must maintain majority (>50.1%) of voting control. Standard for private-equity-backed deals.
children.name: Pre-IPO: Majority Standard

children.definition: Any person or group acquires 35% or more of voting stock post-IPO. Standard market threshold for public companies.
children.name: Post-IPO: 35% Threshold
children.definition_source: Review Template Row 108 (Unknown); KCT Cat 1 Item 2

children.definition: Rules for attributing ownership: direct vs. indirect, 'group' aggregation under Section 13(d), voting vs. economic rights distinctions.
children.name: Attribution & Aggregation Rules

children.definition: Whether the ownership test references 'person' only or 'person or group' including beneficial ownership aggregation under securities laws.
children.name: 'Person' vs. 'Group' Definitions

children.definition: Permitted Holders cease to own more than a specified percentage of voting equity. Most common trigger, with different pre-IPO and post-IPO standards.
children.name: Ownership / Voting Control Test

children.definition: Trigger based on inability to elect or maintain majority of board of directors. Continuing director concepts may expand or narrow the trigger.
children.name: Board Control Test

children.definition: Sale of all or substantially all assets of the borrower and its restricted subsidiaries. Prevents empty-shell credit support.
children.name: Asset Transfer Test

children.definition: Structural chain tests: Holdings ceases to own 100% of Borrower equity, or Borrower ceases to own key subsidiary equity.
children.name: Structural Test

children.definition: CEO/COO/key management change triggers, typically combined with ownership test within a 12-month window. Selective inclusion.
children.name: Management Continuity Test

children.definition: Multi-test framework combining ownership, governance, structural, and management tests. PC Term Comparison provides detailed guidance: 'Flag if definition includes features like: Any investor at close is a Permitted Holder; Sponsor definition broader than Controlled Affiliates or includes portcos; Unlimited management inclusion; Loose "group" definitions; Below majority ownership pre-IPO.' KCT Category 3 item 12 flags: 'A change of control or dilution of the original shareholder/sponsor's control over the borrower's voting shares is allowed through: (a) any formulation of CoC that deviates from the standard loans-type CoC language that requires existing shareholders at the time of closing to maintain economic and voting control of the Borrower, or (b) the insertion exceptions to the concept "change of control" such as "permitted change of control" provisions.'
children.name: Trigger Definitions

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Limited to material restricted subs; 5BD interest grace; 30d rep cure; covenant-lite (financial covenant default not EoD for TL until revolver accelerates); no non-monetary judgment EoD
hot_button_items: (v) cross default and cross acceleration to material indebtedness
(x) actual (or assertion by a Loan Party in writing of) invalidity of any guarantee or any security documents or the invalidity of any lien with regard to any Collateral
key_negotiation_axes: non_monetary_judgment: included vs MAE_subject vs excluded
subsidiary_scope: all vs material_only vs group_materiality
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: 14 enumerated triggers including: nonpayment (principal immediate, interest/fees 3BD), covenant violation, cross-default, bankruptcy (60d involuntary), ERISA, judgments, invalidity of docs/guarantees/liens, CoC, material contract termination, indemnification proceeds

children.definition_source: PC Term Comparison Change of Control: Permitted Holders section (5 flag items); KCT Category 3 item 12 (CoC dilution through deviation from standard language or permitted CoC provisions)

children.definition: Core fund entities, controlled investment affiliates (77% include), successor funds, and parallel fund vehicles.
children.name: Sponsor & Affiliates
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 87 (Transactions with Affiliates); KCT Cat 3 Item 12

children.definition: Current and future management rollover equity holders. 31.1% inclusion rate.
children.name: Management Stockholders

children.definition: Entities designated alongside the controlling sponsor as permitted holders whose acquisition of voting equity does not trigger the change of control provision. Typically includes co-investment vehicles, fund affiliates, and identified strategic partners that participated in the original acquisition, whose continued or increased ownership is consistent with the sponsor-led governance that lenders underwrote at closing.
children.name: Co-Investors

children.definition: Spouse, children, family trusts, estate planning vehicles included as Permitted Holders. 4.9% inclusion rate.
children.name: Family & Trust Provisions

children.definition: Whether passive financial investors or index funds that acquire ownership are excluded from triggering a CoC event.
children.name: Passive Investor Exclusion

children.definition: Designated equity investors whose ownership does not trigger a change of control. PC Term Comparison flags: 'Flag if definition includes features like: Any investor at close is a Permitted Holder; Sponsor definition broader than Controlled Affiliates or includes portcos; Unlimited management inclusion; Loose "group" definitions; Below majority ownership pre-IPO.' Standard formulation requires existing shareholders at closing to maintain economic and voting control. Loose Permitted Holder definitions allow equity dilution without triggering the covenant. PC Term Comparison portability guidance lists required conditions if portability is accepted: 'Min AUM or list of IDed sponsors; Permitted Jurisdiction, not sanctioned; Full KYC; Min equity contribution; Pro forma compliance with Leverage Ratio; Default Stopper; Only 1 permitted; With [24] months of close; Officer's certificate.'
children.name: Permitted Holders

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Limited to material restricted subs; 5BD interest grace; 30d rep cure; covenant-lite (financial covenant default not EoD for TL until revolver accelerates); no non-monetary judgment EoD
hot_button_items: (v) cross default and cross acceleration to material indebtedness
(x) actual (or assertion by a Loan Party in writing of) invalidity of any guarantee or any security documents or the invalidity of any lien with regard to any Collateral
key_negotiation_axes: non_monetary_judgment: included vs MAE_subject vs excluded
subsidiary_scope: all vs material_only vs group_materiality
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: 14 enumerated triggers including: nonpayment (principal immediate, interest/fees 3BD), covenant violation, cross-default, bankruptcy (60d involuntary), ERISA, judgments, invalidity of docs/guarantees/liens, CoC, material contract termination, indemnification proceeds

children.definition_source: PC Term Comparison Change of Control: Permitted Holders section (5 definition risk flags); PC Term Comparison portability conditions (9 requirements if accepted)

children.definition: Whether prepayment is at par (100%), par plus call premium, or 101% (high-yield convention).
children.name: Prepayment Price

children.definition: Days borrower must provide notice of CoC prepayment offer. Typical: 30-60 days. DLS reveals thresholds not in definition: 3 business days, 30 day, 30 days, 5 business days
children.name: Notice Period

children.definition: Automatic exit right for each lender individually.
children.name: Mandatory Prepayment
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 70 (Unknown); Review Template Row 147 (Unknown)

children.definition: Whether the change of control provision specifies Event of Default as one of its enumerated consequences, alongside mandatory prepayment offers and commitment termination. This consequence perspective focuses on the CoC remedial framework â€” when a CoC occurs, what actions are triggered, rather than how CoC is classified among default types.
children.name: Event of Default Trigger

children.definition: CoC triggers both mandatory prepayment and an Event of Default. Most lender-protective consequence.
children.name: Dual Trigger (Prepay + EoD)

children.definition: CoC does not trigger mandatory prepayment or EoD. Only consent requirements and information rights apply.
children.name: No Mandatory Consequence

children.definition: What happens when a change of control occurs: mandatory prepayment, EoD trigger, or both. DLS Preferred row 90 clause (xi) lists change of control as a standard Event of Default. PC Term Comparison: 'Portability is unlikely to be accepted. If present, flag for Clients.' The standard consequence in leveraged credit agreements is either (a) a put right requiring mandatory prepayment at par, (b) an Event of Default enabling acceleration, or (c) both. DLS Preferred treats CoC as an EoD (highlighted for negotiation). Some agreements include a dual mechanism where CoC triggers mandatory offer followed by EoD if not fully prepaid.

extraction_refs.difficulty_note: Aligned from ontology=medium vs playbook=very_hard (playbook authority for extraction complexity)

children.name: Consequence Framework

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Limited to material restricted subs; 5BD interest grace; 30d rep cure; covenant-lite (financial covenant default not EoD for TL until revolver accelerates); no non-monetary judgment EoD
hot_button_items: (v) cross default and cross acceleration to material indebtedness
(x) actual (or assertion by a Loan Party in writing of) invalidity of any guarantee or any security documents or the invalidity of any lien with regard to any Collateral
key_negotiation_axes: non_monetary_judgment: included vs MAE_subject vs excluded
subsidiary_scope: all vs material_only vs group_materiality
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: 14 enumerated triggers including: nonpayment (principal immediate, interest/fees 3BD), covenant violation, cross-default, bankruptcy (60d involuntary), ERISA, judgments, invalidity of docs/guarantees/liens, CoC, material contract termination, indemnification proceeds

children.definition_source: DLS Preferred row 90 clause (xi) (CoC as EoD, highlighted); PC Term Comparison Change of Control section (portability unlikely)

children.definition: New sponsor must meet minimum assets under management threshold.
children.name: Minimum AUM Requirement

children.definition: Pro forma leverage must satisfy specified ratio after giving effect to the change of control.
children.name: Leverage Compliance
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 41 (Maximum leverage); KCT Cat 3 Item 12

children.definition: Maximum period during which portability provisions apply (risk threshold: >24 months).
children.name: Time Limit

children.definition: Whether a 'no default or EoD' condition must be satisfied for the permitted CoC exception to apply.
children.name: Default Stopper

children.definition: Requirements for a CoC to be 'permitted': minimum AUM of acquiror, KYC compliance, equity contribution, leverage compliance, no default, 24-month time limit.
children.name: Permitted CoC Conditions

children.definition: Whether CoC triggers can be 'ported' to a new owner/sponsor group. Rare in leveraged loans; more common in high-yield bond context.
children.name: Portability

children.definition: Provisions permitting certain changes of control subject to conditions. Risk: if not time-limited (>24 months), creates prolonged exposure. KCT Risk Item 12.
children.name: Permitted Change of Control / Portability

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Limited to material restricted subs; 5BD interest grace; 30d rep cure; covenant-lite (financial covenant default not EoD for TL until revolver accelerates); no non-monetary judgment EoD
hot_button_items: (v) cross default and cross acceleration to material indebtedness
(x) actual (or assertion by a Loan Party in writing of) invalidity of any guarantee or any security documents or the invalidity of any lien with regard to any Collateral
key_negotiation_axes: non_monetary_judgment: included vs MAE_subject vs excluded
subsidiary_scope: all vs material_only vs group_materiality
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: 14 enumerated triggers including: nonpayment (principal immediate, interest/fees 3BD), covenant violation, cross-default, bankruptcy (60d involuntary), ERISA, judgments, invalidity of docs/guarantees/liens, CoC, material contract termination, indemnification proceeds

children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 49 (Forecasts); KCT Cat 3 Item 12; Review Template Row 130 (Change of Control)

children.definition: How the CoC ownership trigger changes post-IPO: from >50% Permitted Holder control to 35% third-party acquisition threshold.
children.name: Trigger Modification

children.definition: Exception for widely-held public companies where no single holder exceeds the threshold.
children.name: Public Float Exception

children.definition: Special provisions for de-SPAC transactions addressing change of control mechanics in blank-check company contexts.
children.name: SPAC Accommodation

children.definition: Modifications to CoC triggers and Permitted Holder definitions upon an IPO event. Pre-IPO sponsor majority standard transitions to post-IPO third-party acquisition threshold.

extraction_refs.difficulty_note: Aligned from ontology=medium vs playbook=very_hard (playbook authority for extraction complexity)

children.name: IPO Adaptation

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Limited to material restricted subs; 5BD interest grace; 30d rep cure; covenant-lite (financial covenant default not EoD for TL until revolver accelerates); no non-monetary judgment EoD
hot_button_items: (v) cross default and cross acceleration to material indebtedness
(x) actual (or assertion by a Loan Party in writing of) invalidity of any guarantee or any security documents or the invalidity of any lien with regard to any Collateral
key_negotiation_axes: non_monetary_judgment: included vs MAE_subject vs excluded
subsidiary_scope: all vs material_only vs group_materiality
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: 14 enumerated triggers including: nonpayment (principal immediate, interest/fees 3BD), covenant violation, cross-default, bankruptcy (60d involuntary), ERISA, judgments, invalidity of docs/guarantees/liens, CoC, material contract termination, indemnification proceeds

definition: Provisions triggering a mandatory prepayment obligation or Event of Default upon a change in ownership or control of the borrower group. DLS Preferred includes change of control as EoD clause (xi). KCT Category 3 item 12 flags deviations from standard loans-type CoC language requiring existing shareholders at closing to maintain economic and voting control, including: (a) any formulation deviating from standard language, and (b) insertion of exceptions such as 'permitted change of control' provisions. PC Term Comparison: portability (permitting a CoC without triggering the provision) is unlikely to be accepted; if present, should include minimum AUM or identified sponsors, permitted jurisdiction, not sanctioned, full KYC, minimum equity contribution, pro forma leverage compliance, Default stopper, limited to one occurrence within 24 months of close, and officer's certificate. Permitted Holder definition should be scrutinized for: any investor at close being a Permitted Holder, sponsor definition broader than controlled affiliates, unlimited management inclusion, loose 'group' definitions, and below-majority ownership pre-IPO.
name: Change of Control
definition_source: DLS Preferred row 90 clause (xi) (CoC as EoD); KCT Category 3 item 12 (CoC deviations and exceptions); PC Term Comparison Change of Control section (portability conditions, Permitted Holder definition flags)

market_benchmarks.pctc_portability_conditions: Min AUM or listed sponsors, permitted jurisdiction, not sanctioned, full KYC, min equity, pro forma leverage compliance, Default stopper, only 1 permitted, within 24 months, officer cert
market_benchmarks.pctc_portability_acceptance: Unlikely to be accepted; if present, flag for Clients
market_benchmarks.permitted_holder_flags: Any investor at close, sponsor broader than controlled affiliates, unlimited management, loose group definitions, below-majority pre-IPO
market_benchmarks.pctc_portability_conditions_source: PC Term Comparison Change of Control section
market_benchmarks.permitted_holder_flags_source: PC Term Comparison Change of Control section
market_benchmarks._source: PC Term Comparison Change of Control section; KCT Category 3 item 12
